titleInfo.title: COMPREHENSIVE OPIOID ABUSE REDUCTION ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: COMPREHENSIVE OPIOID ABUSE REDUCTION ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 75

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Comprehensive Opioid Abuse Reduction Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5046, to amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize the Attorney General to make grants to assist State and local governments in addressing the national epidemic of opioid abuse, by a yea-and-nay vote of 413 yeas to 5 nays, Roll No. 187.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-52 shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule.<P/>Lynch amendment (No. 9 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-551) that sought to provide that grant funding can be used to develop, implement or expand a program to ensure the security of opioids in medical facilities (by a recorded vote of 190 ayes to 225 noes, Roll No. 186).

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Comprehensive Opioid Abuse Reduction Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5046, to amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize the Attorney General to make grants to assist State and local governments in addressing the national epidemic of opioid abuse, by a yea-and-nay vote of 413 yeas to 5 nays, Roll No. 187.

extension.searchTitle: VETERAN EMERGENCY MEDICAL TECHNICIAN SUPPORT ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 75

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Veteran Emergency Medical Technician Support Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Wednesday, May 11th:<P/>H.R. 1818, amended, to amend the Public Health Service Act to provide grants to States to streamline State requirements and procedures for veterans with military emergency medical training to become civilian emergency medical technicians, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 415 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 188; and

extension.searchTitle: LALI'S LAW; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 75

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Wednesday, May 11th:<P/>H.R. 4586, amended, to amend the Public Health Service Act to authorize grants to States for developing standing orders and educating health care professionals regarding the dispensing of opioid overdose reversal medication without person-specific prescriptions, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 415 yeas to 4 nays, Roll No. 189.

extension.searchTitle: ENERGY AND WATER DEVELOPMENT AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 75

congVote.result: The bill (H.R. 2028), as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies Appropriations Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 90 yeas to 8 nays (Vote No. 71), Senate passed H.R. 2028, making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2016, after taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:
